&COMPANY_NAME_SHORT; &PB; &PRODUCT_VERSION; - Currently Unsupported Device Features
&legal; This document list features that function differently under &PB; &PRODUCT_VERSION;, as oppposed to a bare-metal installation.
Functional limitations of &PB; versus a bare-metal install
All manufacturers
The following &PB; limitation apply to all supported devices:
eSATA is not supported.
FireWire and IEEE 1394 device are not supported.
External monitors can only mirror the device display (no 'extend desktop to this monitor' feature).
I/O cards (network, SAN and modem cards) in expansion slots are not supported.
Full Disk Encryption (FDE) is not supported.
Display rotation on external monitors is only supported on &HDX; VMs.
WPA-Enterprise is limited to Linux-based WLAN supplicant limits.
Network Access Protection (NAP) is not supported.
Internal dial-up modems are not supported.
The middle button of a built-in track pad is not supported.
Upgrading the device BIOS in Windows is not supported.
PCIe devices are currently not supported.
Display Port(DP) is currently not supported.
SD/MMC cards are currently not supported.
Expresscard is not supported.
Intel Matrix Storage Manager is not supported.
The use of Blu-ray disks is not supported.
All laptop batteries are displayed as a single battery.
Dell-specific limitations
This section lists Dell device features that have no or limited support under &PB;:
On-Demand Desktop Streaming (ODDS) solution with Dell EasyConnect technology is not supported.
Dell PC Suite is not supported.
Dell Control Point Software (DCP), which drives the fingerprint reader and ambient light sensor, is not supported.
HP-specific limitations
HP Value Add Software is not supported under &PB;:
HP Protect Tools
Java Card Security is not supported.
Drive Encryption is not supported.
Embedded Security is not supported.
LoJack is not supported.
Pre-boot authentication is not supported with HP Protect tools software.
Other
CDRW/DVDRW Light Scribe Drives are not supported.
